pageContext.description: Probably bronze coated with iron, if not iron throughout. A small piece of shaft remains also part of a rivet. Of a type rare outside the British Isles. Although made on a bronze model appears to be of iron and thus belongs to a period when iron was first introduced and its technique not yet properly mastered. Edge is rather chipped and the collar at socket mouth is a separate piece of metal from the rest.
pageContext.patina: Dark greenish and greyish green patina.
pageContext.surface: Smooth. Stem of socket is very slightly encrusted outside and on one side there is a thin layer of fine gravel almost all over.
pageContext.other: Length: blade 189mm; socket 105mm,Width: blade 43mm; socket 32mm,Thickness: blade 4mm; 6mm; socket 25mm,Weight: 255.15 gms
pageContext.toSearch: Llyn Fawr, Aberdare, Rhondda Cynon Taff Cf44, UK
